numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts the likelihood of an admission advantage at some colleges.
2. The graph compares applicants who have the same test scores.
3. The graph compares applicants who have a legacy advantage with applicants who do not have a legacy advantage.
4. I noticed a legacy student whose parents are in the top 0.1% of income.
5. I noticed that this legacy student is 7 times more likely to be admitted than a less wealthy student.
6. This situation must annoy students who try to get into an elite college.
7. I noticed that legacy applicants are admitted significantly more often than non-legacy applicants.
8. This is true regardless of income.
9. I noticed that students who have a legacy advantage are wealthier than students who do not have a legacy advantage.
10. I wonder why students with low income have a smaller legacy advantage.
11. Maybe wealthier applicants can afford high tuition costs.
12. Maybe wealthier applicants can donate money to an elite college.
13. Low-income applicants would struggle to pay high tuition costs.
14. Low-income applicants would request financial aid.
15. I wonder how income and a legacy advantage affect admission to an elite college.
16. I wonder whether an applicant who requests financial aid is more likely to be deferred.
17. I wonder whether an applicant who requests financial aid is more likely to be rejected.
18. This situation affects me and my community.
19. I am a sophomore.
20. I am starting to research colleges.
21. Next year I will apply to colleges.
22. Next year I will look at schools.
23. I have 2 older sisters.
24. My 2 older sisters applied to colleges without a legacy advantage.
25. My 2 older sisters were admitted.
26. I have a family friend.
27. My family friend has a legacy advantage for Villanova.
28. Her uncle attended Villanova.
29. My family friend was deferred.
30. The title of the graph is "Legacy".
